page.title: 01Slyne-with-Hest 1985
page.content: Slyne-with-Hest is a suburban village north of Lancaster and Morecambe.It lies next to the wide sandy expanse of Morecambe Bay,famous for its wildlife and attracts many people for holidays and day trips. Slyne-with-Hest has a large variety of houses,there are 3 churches,and 3 farms in the area. There are only a few shops in the village,but at Princess Crescent on the edge of Morecambe there is a wider range of shops.The one school in the area is St.Luke's Primary School with 190 pupils.Near the shore runs the London-Glasgow railway.Running through the village is the Lancaster Canal,it contains much wildlife and many pleasure boats use it.Slyne-with- Hest has a wide range of leisure activites,including Happy Mount Park, Morecambe Golf Club,a Memorial Hall and a recreation field.
